==Japanese==
[[Image:Pieris japonica 10.jpg|thumb]]

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=あせび}}
The original [[kun'yomi]] pronunciation of this word was ''ashibi'', now considered a variant reading.

The leaves of the plant were known to [[intoxicate]] horses when eaten, causing horses to [[stumble]] and become weak in the legs. As such, this word is most likely a contraction of {{l|ja|足}}{{m|ja|癈|tr=''ashijihi''||numbness in the feet/legs}}.

The kanji {{lang|ja|馬酔木}} are an example of [[熟字訓|jukujikun]], meaning literally ''horse intoxicating tree''.
